result.execSummary:
The defendant Kothar B Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school or any other approved activity by Agent.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Pick N Save at any location.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kothar B Bishop

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison 5/26/15
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 2/17/15.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kothar B Bishop in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 1/2 years, Extended Supervision: 6 months) - concurrent to Ct. 4  Stayed for 2 years Probation concurrent to Ct. 4 but consecutive to any other sentence - Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County - 43 days credit if revoked. 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s.. AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform agent of all prescriptions. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No Drug Paraphernalia. Maintain full-time employment and/or school or any other approved activity by Agent.  No contact with Pick n' Save at any locations. Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
 - 60 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Agent to use their discretion as to huber or straight time. 

Ct 4:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 1/2 years, Extended Supervision: 6 months) - concurrent to Ct. 1 Stayed for 2 years Probation concurrent to Ct. 1 but consecutive to any other sentence - Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County - 43 days credit if revoked. 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s.. AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform agent of all prescriptions. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No Drug Paraphernalia. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by Agent.  No contact with Pick n' Save at any locations. Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 2/11/15.

Defendant Kothar B Bishop in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge Fragoso for attorney Kelsey Morin.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Fragoso is requesting a date next week on behalf of attorney Morin for a plea/sentencing.  Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Kothar B Bishop in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
